data: moorland parish | cairn | heather | brae-side | monument

In the wild end of a moorland parish, far out of the sight of any house, there stands a cairn among the heather, and a little by east of it, in the going down of the brae-side, a monument with some verses half defaced.
Weir of Hermiston: An Unfinished Romance
